text:
Check out the amazing job market candidates from our economics and education group here:

www.tc.columbia.edu/education-po...

I'm the placement director/DGS and happy to field all/any inquiries. 

They are objectively great!!!

(new post with link fixed!!)

The Impact of Brief Interventions With Condom Demonstrations on Youth: A Systematic Review www.mathematica.org/en/publicati... 

"Our review found evidence that brief interventions with condom demonstrations have potential effects on behavioral and nonbehavioral outcomes"
Blog your job market paper: our annual opportunity for job market candidates in development to share their work is now open for submissions blogs.worldbank.org/impactevalua...

Congratulations to Claudia Goldin for her groundbreaking work on gender and the workplace, with a historical perspective!

x.com/NobelPrize/s...
A short writeup about our work on school construction, appeared in Yale Insights and Yale News: t.co/OcWw8uU9cS

🚨CALL FOR PAPERS🚨

Hey #EconSky 

We are now accepting submissions for Season 7 of the Applied Young Economist Webinar! 

Submission Deadlines: 

Development Economics: Thursday, 5/10/2023 
Other Workshops: Thursday, 12/10/2023 

Details below⬇️

Help us spread the word!

Hello #Econsky 📉📈

I am starting to prep for a course on Data Science for Economists. 

What are your go-to materials? What is your favorite book?

Does anybody have any suggestions?

Want to teach something that is fun and practical to Emory 4+1 students!

#Econsky 📈📉:?What are your top recommendations for cool RCT papers with null effects? 📚 (I know there has been discussions about this before; I keep bookmarking and losing them. Maybe by starting this thread, I can easily locate them later). TIA!

Just came across this cool paper! "A Signal to End Child Marriage: Theory and Experimental Evidence from Bangladesh." by Nina Buchmann, Erica Field, Rachel Glennerster, Shahana Nazneen, and Xiao Yu Wang. 2023.  American Economic Review www.aeaweb.org/articles?id=... #Econsky 📈📉

How can colleges pursue diversity without affirmative action? 

My Urban Institute colleague Bryan Cook shares several ideas in a new report: www.urban.org/research/pub...
And in more conference news--the Midwest Economics Association is coming back to Chicago in March 2024. Individual paper abstracts due Oct. 15; organized sessions due Dec. 1. mea.sites.grinnell.edu

Sounds like folks are worried about losing data access during a possible government shutdown, so I quickly whipped up this Education Data Portal with all the major datasets on schools, districts, and colleges: educationdata.urban.org/documentation/

I just found a cool feature on here, a way to kind of get verified. 

For all who host their own domain (for example for a personal website), you can change your Bluesky handle to that domain name as described here by @@138589: @138589/bluesky-use-...
